intro: Chlorophytum somaliense, commonly known as the Somali spider plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Somalia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers on long, slender inflorescences. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Chlorophytum somaliense is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
